intro: Scholtzia chapmanii, commonly known as Chapman's scholtzia, is a flowering plant native to the coastal regions of central and southern California. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family, and is characterized by its succulent, fleshy leaves and vibrant yellow flowers. The plant thrives in sandy, well-drained soils and is adapted to coastal climates with high salinity and wind exposure. Scholtzia chapmanii is typically found in open habitats such as dunes, grasslands, and rocky slopes, where it plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and supporting local biodiversity.
